shows.title: Spirit World Collaboration / Multidimensional Travel
shows.first_half: First Half: Guest host Ryan Wrecker (email) talks with author Julie Kramer about how we can collaborate with the spirit world. Kramer believes everyone has this ability, and she'll discuss the different ways to sharpen it. She'll also speak about both Eastern and Western Medicine, as well as psychotherapy.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Spiritual teacher Steve Rother will discuss channeling and why he believes the multidimensional walls are thinning. He'll also discuss shadow figures, practical magic, and the "six technology drops" from ETs that Rother claims are about to explode on Earth, changing everything.

shows.title: Climate Agenda / Exposing UFO Secrets
shows.first_half: First Half: Author Frank Lasee will address what he sees as a deliberate misinformation campaign surrounding climate and energy. He'll attempt to unravel the agenda behind the climate change narrative, and he'll dive into how costly policies are driving up energy and food prices.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author and spiritual teacher Richard Lawrence will bring us the explosive truths behind UFO secrecy, from shadowy government cover-ups and extraterrestrial encounters to suppressed spiritual knowledge that could upend the deep state. He'll also discuss the footage revealed in Congress just last month.

shows.title: Kindness & Wellbeing / Horror Films & Demons
shows.first_half: First Half: Stephen Post, who researches compassion, will discuss the relationship between altruism, kindness, and wellbeing. He'll explore psychological health as well as various other areas of medical care and recovery.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Joseph Laycock will speak about religion, horror, and demons. He'll examine the relationship between horror films, actual events, and the public's belief in demonic topics, including possession and satanic cults.

shows.title: Son of Spock / Exploring UFO Phenomena
shows.first_half: First Half: Director, lawyer, and author Adam Nimoy will discuss his experience growing up with Mr. Spock (Leonard Nimoy) as his father, and how Star Trek became a defining cultural force. He'll reflect on how the character of Mr. Spock shaped not only his relationship with his father, but also his own understanding of identity and purpose.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Attorney, science teacher, and bestselling author Kent Heckenlively will explore the past 80 years of UFO phenomena. He'll also cover current congressional hearings, as well as his interviews with UFO luminaries.

shows.title: History of Civilization / Defining Evil
shows.first_half: First Half: Dr. Robert M. Schoch will discuss his latest work demonstrating that there was civilization prior to the end of the last Ice Age roughly 12,000 years ago. Dr. Schoch will also explain how he re-dated the origins of the Great Sphinx from circa 2,500 BC to thousands of years earlier, claiming the current head is likely a re-carving.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author and researcher Heidi Hollis will examine the depths of evil, what it is, and where it hides. She'll explore the three realms where evil operates: within humanity, among demons, and by interdimensional entities often described as aliens.

shows.title: Investigating Bigfoot / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Guest host Connie Willis (info) speaks with Bigfoot researcher Thom "Cat" Cantrall about his life investigating hairy cryptids. He'll also share a surprising story about an interplanetary journey. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half—give Connie a call and discuss whatever's on your mind!
